name: emi.arc-client
description:
The new libarcclient makes extensive use of plugins for command handling. These plugins are handled by a

set of higher level classes which thus are the ones to offer the plugin functionality to external calls. In this

section an overview of the library’s main functionality is given which also introduces the most important

higher level classes.
releaseNotes:
What's new



    * High priority bugs fixed:

          o 2475 XRSLParserTest fails on some 64bit platforms: RHEL 4+5, SL5, Fedora 5+6

          o 2472 Period and Time not usable with python for missing methods to get values

          o 2423 arctest can not find targets, reports bogus error

          o 1887 arcstat -a very inefficient

          o 2452 ARClib's DownloadDirectory aborts with: globus_list_rest: Assertion `head = 0' failed.

          o 2463 argget report failure in downloading jobs from ARC0 sites

    * Medium priority bugs fixed:

          o 2148 User tools (arccp/rm/ls) should uri encode their arguments before using them

          o 2426 typo in job description for arctest -J1

          o 2429 ldapsearch should escape parentheses

          o 2469 arcsub seg faults when [] is in the job description

          o 2520 GGUS-Ticket-ID: #72340 EMI1 ARC CE 1.0.0 wrong user mapping

          o 2442 ARC incompatible with CERN voms server

          o 2420 arcproxy manpage errors

          o 2365 Job submission failed, no more possible targets however server is health

          o 2484 ARClib does not export the version number/string

          o 2288 More informative errors in arcstat when a site is down

          o 2430 ARC shouldn't request a gsiftp URL when it isn't configured to use one

          o 2431 ARC should release the TURL after transfer failure

          o 2458 arcls fails to list files on dcache gridftp server

          o 2493 ngrm command line options descriptions differ

    * Less urgent bugs fixed:

          o 2529 arcproxy: wrong error message when key/certificate files are absent



Deployment notes:

    * This release does not introduce any changes in the deployment procedures described in ARC Clients documentation



Known Issues

    * Bugs 2471 and 2485 (requesting two versions of the same runtime environment simultaneously) are not fixed yet.

    * For bug 2473 (crash in SWIG-generated Python library) only a workaround exists so far.
